subject: BE SURE TO SHINE
verse: Let your good deeds shine out for all to see so that everyone will praise your heavenly Father. (Mt. 5/16)
reflection: If we live for Christ, we will glow like lights, showing others what Christ is like. We hide our light by (1) being quiet when we should speak. (2) going along with the crowd. (3) denying the light. (4) letting sin dim our light. (5) not explain our light to others. (6) Or, Ignoring the needs of others. BE A BEACON OF TRUTH -- DON'T SHUT YOUR LIGHT OFF FROM THE REST OF THE WORLD.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 5-2-2019:

_Let your good deeds shine out for all to see so that_

_everyone will praise your heavenly Father. _(Mt. 5/16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY

If we live for Christ, we will glow like lights, showing others

what Christ is like. We hide our light by (1) being quiet when

we should speak. (2) going along with the crowd. (3) denying

the light. (4) letting sin dim our light. (5) not explain our light

to others. (6) Or, Ignoring the needs of others. BE A BEACON OF

TRUTH -- DON'T SHUT YOUR LIGHT OFF FROM THE REST OF THE WORLD.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: JUST WHAT WE NEED
verse: We can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves receive from God. (2 Cor. 1:4)
reflection: All around us are people in need, and sometimes we have to set aside our own feelings and agendas to help them. One way we can do that is to remember how God has comforted us in our trials and troubles "so we can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves have received from God. How easy it is to be engrossed in our own concerns and forget that someone right next to us might need a prayer, a word of comfort, a hug, or a gift of mercy in Jesus's name. COMFORT RECEIVED SHOULD BE COMFORT GIVEN.
original_content:
VERSE FOR %/3/2019:

_PASTOR AL_

subject: REBUILDING PROJECTS
verse: He has granted us new life to rebuild the house of our God and repair its ruins. (Ezra 9: 9)
reflection: Troubles of our own making and conflicts we can't avoid may leave us devastated. But we have a Father who understands. Gently patiently, He clears away the rubble, repurposes it, and builds something better. It takes time but we can always trust Him. GOD WILL ONE DAY RESTORE ALL THE BEAUTY LOST BEFORE.

_PASTOR AL_

I HAVE TO MAKE A TRIP TO THE CITIES THIS WEEKEND AND I WON'T BE BACK

UNTIL LATE MONDAY (HOPEFULLY)

subject: UNSEEN, YET LOVED
verse: Though you have not seen Him, you love Him. (I Pet. 1: 8)
reflection: Peter, as a personal friend of Jesus, was writing to people who had only heard about the One who had given them reason for so much hope in the middle of their troubles. Yet, as a part of the larger community of believers, they loved Him. They knew that at the price of His own life, He had brought them into the everlasting family of God. OUR LOVE FOR CHRIST IS ONLY AS REAL AS OUR LOVE FOR OUR NEIGHBOR.
original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 8:

that at the price of His own life, He had brought them into the

everlasting family of God. OUR LOVE FOR CHRIST IS ONLY AS REAL

AS OUR LOVE FOR OUR NEIGHBOR.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: KEEP CLIMBING!
verse: Encourage one another daily. (Heb. 3:13)
reflection: Through His death and resurrection, Jesus has connected us to one another. So we have the responsibility and privilege with God's enablement to encourage fellow believers to finish the climb of trusting and obeying Him. SO LET US REMEMBER, TO ENCOURAGE ONE ANOTHER AND BUILD ONE ANOTHER UP.

TO ENCOURAGE ONE ANOTHER AND BUILD ONE ANOTHER UP.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: OUR DIVINE DEFENSE
verse: Take the sword of the Spirit, which is the Word of God. (Eph.6:17)
reflection: If we think that working for God doesn't matter, we should turn to the promise that what we do for Jesus will last for eternity( I Cor. 3:11-15). If we fear we have sinned too greatly for Godto use us, we must remember we've been forgiven by the powerof Jesus's blood (Mat. 26:28). And if we're worried we might fail if we try to serve God, we should remember that Jesus said we willbear fruit as we abide in Him (Jn. 15:5). GOD'S WORD IS OUR DIVINE DEFENSE.
original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 10_Take . . . The sword of the Spirit, which is the Word

we've been forgiven by the powerof Jesus's blood (Mat. 26:28). And if
we're worried we might fail if we try to serve God, we should remember
that Jesus said we willbear fruit as we abide in Him (Jn. 15:5).
GOD'S WORD IS OUR DIVINE DEFENSE._ PASTOR AL_

subject: START FRESH
verse: His compassions never fail. They are new every morning; great is your faithfulness. (Lam. 3:22-23)
reflection: Some of us have made wrong choices in our lives, but our pastwords and deeds need not define our future in God's eyes. Thereis always a fresh start. When we ask for His forgiveness, WE TAKEa first step toward restoring our relationship with Him and with others. "If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness." (I Jn. 1:9) EACH NEW DAY GIVES US NEW REASONS TO PRAISE THE LORD.

subject: GOD'S AGENTS
verse: For God did not send His Son into the word to condemn theworld but to save the world through Him. (John 3:17)
reflection: The more SOME PEOPLE read the Bible, the more they judge others who aren't doing what it says. Instead let us take thisapproach, let us show them God's love and let the Holy Spiritreshape them. INSTEAD OF BEING AGENTS OF CONDEMNATION, WE ARE TO BE AMBASSADORS OF GOD'S LOVE AND MERCY.

the more they judge others who aren't doing what it says. Instead let
us take thisapproach, let us show them God's love and let the Holy
Spiritreshape them. INSTEAD OF BEING AGENTS OF CONDEMNATION, WE ARE TO
BE AMBASSADORS OF GOD'S LOVE AND MERCY. _ PASTOR AL___

subject: NOT FORGOTTEN
verse: I will not forget you! (Isa. 49:15)
reflection: God compared His love for His people with a mother's love for her child. When we are distressed or disillusioned, we may feel abandoned by society, family, and friends, but God does not abandon us. It is an encouragement that the Lord says, "I have engraved you on the palms of my hands. (vs. 16) to indicate how much He knows and protects us. EVEN IF PEOPLE FORSAKE US, GOD WILL NEVER FORSAKE HIS OWN.

subject: FIELD OF SERVICE
verse: Jesus said, "My food, is to do the will of Him who sent me, and to finish His work." (Jn. 4:34)
reflection: The food which Jesus was speaking of was His special nourishment. It includes more than Bible study, prayer, and attending church services. Spiritual nourishment also comes from doing God's will and helping to bring His work of salvation to completion. WE ARE NOURISHED NOTONLY BY WHAT WE TAKE IN, BUT ALSO BY WHAT WE GIVE OUTFOR GOD.

subject: ALWAYS IN HIS CARE
verse: You know when I sit and when I rise, You perceive my thoughts from afar. (Ps. 139:2)
reflection: When it comes to our relationship with God we don't need radios, phones, or emergency beacons. no matter how precarious our circumstances become, He already knows who and where we are. The psalmist celebrated this when he wrote, "You have searched me, Lord, and You know me. . . You are familiar with all my ways." (Ps. 139: 1-3) OUR NEEDS ARE NEVER HIDDEN FROM GOD, AND WE ARE NEVER SEPARATED FROM HIS CARE.

subject: IS HE GOOD ? ?
verse: The serpent said, "Really? did God really say you must not eat any of the fruit of the garden? (Gen. 3: 1)
reflection: Satan tempted Eve and succeeded, in getting her to sin. He even tempted Jesus (Mt. 4: 1-11) But Jesus did not sin! How could Eve have resisted this temptation? By following the same guide lines we can follow. FIRST: we must realize that being tempted is not a sin. We have not sinned until we give into the temptation. THEN, to resist temptation, we must (1) pray for strength to resist (2) run sometimes literally and (3) say no when confronted what we now is wrong. JM. 1:12 TELLS OF THE BLESSINGS AND REWARDS FOR THOSE WHO DON'T GIVE IN WHEN TEMPTED

DON'T GIVE IN WHEN TEMPTED._ PASTOR AL_

subject: TIME TO GROW
verse: At the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up. (Gal. 6:9)
reflection: Do you ever get discouraged by an apparent lack of spiritual growth? Do you frequently lose your temper or enjoy that spicy bit of gossip youjust can't resist passing on! ! Do you get up to late to pray and read yourBible, in spite of resolving to set the alarm earlier. Here is a suggestion, ask a trusted friend about the areas of your life in which you want to grow spiritually and have that person pray for you and encourage you to be accountable. Be patient! ! YOU WILL GROW AS YOU ALLOW THE HOLY SPIRIT TO WORK IN YOU.
original_content:
SORRY IF YOU HAVE ALREADY RECEIVED THIS DEVO. THIS COMPUTER IS WANTING
TO DO IT'S OWN THING

subject: THE BREAD THATY SATISFIES
verse: Give us this day our daily bread: (Lk. 11:3)
reflection: When Martha and Mary invited Jesus to their house it was spiritualfood that Mary chose when she sat at the feet of Jesus (Lk. 10: 39). Martha on the other hand was concerned about physical food, Mary was taking time to be near their guests, and listen to the Lord Jesus. Let us also take time. Let us remember John 6: 35 which tells us Hefeeds our hearts with spiritual food. HE IS THE BREAD THAT SATISFIES.

subject: THE BIBLE CHALLENGES
verse: How sweet are Your words. . . . Sweeter than honey tomy mouth. (Ps. 119: 103)
reflection: God spoke through various writers to pen life changing psalms for our benefit. The teachings of Jesus shape our character tobecome more like Him. The writings of Paul shape our minds andlives to holy living. As the Holy Spirit brings these scriptures to our minds, they become powerful agents for change in our lives. READING GOD'S WORD CHALLENGES US TO BE BETTER.

subject: IMPORTANCE OF AMENTAL STOPWATCH
verse: My dear bothers and sisters, be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to get angry. (Jm. 1:19)
reflection: When we talk to much and listen to little we communicate to others that we think our ideas are much more important then theirs. Jameswisely advices us to reverse this process. He says we should put amental stop watch on our conversations and keep track of how much we talk and how much we listen. NOW WHEN PEOPLE TALK WITH US, DOTHEY FEEL THAT THEIR VIEW POINTS AND IDEAS HAVE VALUE?

subject: GOD'S DWELLING PLACE
verse: There will be no more death or mourning or cryingor pain. (Rev. 21: 4)
prayer: In Rev. 21, John received a vision of a different city--the New Jerusalem. If you will notice he said less aboutit's design and more about the character of those who werethere. THINK OF IT: no more death! Nor will there be any more "Crying or pain. " All these things will be replaced bythe wonderful presence of the God of the universe. REMEMBER THIS WILL BE THE HOME JESUS IS PREPARING FOR ALL WHO TURN TO HIM FOR FORGIVENESS. Amen.

subject: GOD PROVIDES
verse: One thing I do: forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead. (Phil. 3: 13)
reflection: None of us are what we should be, but we can, like the apostle, pray and press on toward that goal. Like Paul we will always say, "I have not yet arrived. " nevertheless, despite weakness, failure, and weariness, we must press on (vs. 12). But everything depends on God. without Him we can do nothing. REMEMBER, GOD IS WITH YOU, CALLING YOU ONWARD, SO KEEPPADDLING.

subject: GRATEFULNESS
verse: Why have I found favor in You eyes? (Ruth 2: 10)
reflection: Like Ruth we are foreigners far from God. We may wonder why Godwould choose to love us when we are so undeserving. The answer is not in us, but in Him. God showed His great love for us when He sentHis Son to die for us while we were still sinners. (Ro. 5: 8) Yes Christhas become our redeemer. When we come to Him in salvation, we areunder His protective wings. GRATEFULNESS IS THE HEART'S RESPONSE IN GOD'S UNDESERVED LOVE.

subject: NO WORRIES
verse: Jesus said to His disciples "Let us go over to the other side. " (Mk 4: 35)
reflection: While crossing this body of water they run into rough weather to the point of swamping the boat. Why was this happening? Jesus was with them but He was asleep at the stern of the boat. They learned that day that IT IS NOT TRUE that when we do as the Lord says, there will be no storms in our lives. In the storms of our life, we can be confident that all is not lost. OUR PILOT CAN HANDLE THE STORM. HE WILL GET US HOME.

stern of the boat. They learned that day that IT IS NOT TRUE that when
we do as the Lord says, there will be no storms in our lives. In the
storms of our life, we can be confident that all is not lost.

OUR PILOT CAN HANDLE THE STORM. HE WILL GET US HOME.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: DEATH HAS BEEN DEFEATED
verse: Jesus said, "I am the resurrection and the life. Those who believe in Me, even though the diethey will live again." (Jn. 11:25)
reflection: Jesus has power over life and death, as well aspower to for give sins. This is because He isthe creator of life (see Jn. 14: 6). He who islife can surely restore life. Whoever believesin Christ has a spiritual life that death cannotconquer or diminish in any way. When we realize His power and how wonderful His offer to us is, how can we not commit our life to Him. Tothose of us who believe, what a wonderful assurance and certainty we have. I WILL LIVEAGAIN AND YOU WILL TOO. (JN. 14: 19)

subject: REMEBER hE HAS WALKED IN OUR SHOES
verse: Because He Himself suffered when He was tempted, He is able to help those who are being tempted. (Heb. 2:18)
reflection: "Because Jesus Himself suffered when He was tempted, He is able to help those who are being tempted. " (VS. 18)The Lord could have avoided the cross. Instead, He obeyed His Father. Through His death, He broke the power of Satanand freed us from our fear of death, (vss. 14-15) IN EVERY TEMPTATION, JESUS WALKS BESIDE US TO GIVE US COURAGE, STRENGTH, AND HOPE ALONG THE WAY.

subject: FLOWING PEACE
verse: Peace I leave with you, My peace I give to you. (Jn. 14:27)
reflection: Even though we are God's children we will still experience hardship, we toohave His Spirit living within and flowing out of us. God's peace canbe His witness to everyone we meet--whether at a local market place, at work, or in a gym. WHEN WE KEEP OUR MIND ON GOD, HIS SPIRIT KEEPS OUR MIND AT PEACE.

subject: DON'T DOUBT GOD'S ABILITY TO LISTEN
verse: Jesus said, "My God, My God, why have you forsakenMe. (Mt. 27: 46)
reflection: Sometimes it seems as though God isn't listening to us. The reason could be that when we pray, we may NOT see how God is working or understand how He will bring any good through it all. So we have to trust Him. We have to relinquish our rights and let God dowhat is best. We must leave the unknown to the all knowing One. WHEN WE BEND OUR KNEES TO PRAY, GOD BENDS HIS EAR TO HEAR.

subject: WHAT GOD OWES US
verse: Live a life worthy of the Lord and please Him in every way. (Col. 1:10)
reflection: As believers in our Lord Jesus Christ we often feel that God owes us such things as, good health, a comfortable life, and material blessings. Of course, God does not owe us anything. Yet He gives useverything Each day whether good or bad, is onemore gift from our God. Our grateful response should be to live for Him. OUR LIFE IS A GIFT FROMGOD AND SHOULD BE LIVED FOR HIM.
original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 29:_Live a life worthy of the Lord and please Him__in
every way._ (Col. 1:10) READ (COL. 1:9-14)THOUGHT FOR TODAY: As
believers in our Lord Jesus Christ we often feel that God owes us such
things as, good health, a comfortable life, and material blessings. Of
course,God does not owe us anything. Yet He gives useverything Each
day whether good or bad, is onemore gift from our God. Our grateful
response should be to live for Him. OUR LIFE IS A GIFT FROMGOD AND
SHOULD BE LIVED FOR HIM._ PASTOR AL_

subject: PRAISE FROM PURE HEARTS
verse: A broken and contrite heart You, God, will not despise. (Ps. 51:17)
reflection: When we are truly broken over our sins, God lovingly puts us back together. "If we confess our sins, He isfaithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purifyus from all unrighteousness. " (I Jn. 1: 9) Humility isthe right response to God's holinesS. AND PRAISE IS OUR HEARTS RESPONSE TO HIS FORGIVENESS.
original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 30:_A broken and contrite heart You, God, will _n_ot__
despise. _ (Ps. 51:17) READ (Ps. 51:7:17)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:when we are
truly broken over our sins, God lovingly puts us back together. "If we
confess our sins, He isfaithful and just and will forgive us our sins
and purifyus from all unrighteousness." (I Jn.. 1:9) Humility isthe
right response to God's holinesS. AND PRAISE IS OUR HEARTS RESPONSE TO
HIS FORGIVENESS.
_ PASTOR AL_

subject: KNOWING AND DOING
verse: With man this is impossible, but not with God; all thingsare possible with God. (Mk. 10: 27)
reflection: What was the Teacher thinking? His own disciples were alarmed and asked, "who then can be saved?" Jesus replied, "With man this is impossible, but not with God; all things are possible with God. " (vs. 27) It takes courageand faith. "If you declare with your mouth, Jesus is Lord, and believe in your hear that God raised Him from the dead, your will be saved. (Ro. 10: 9) BELIEVE IN THE LORD JESUS, AND YOU WILL BE SAVED.
original_content:
VERSE FOR MAY 31:_With man this is impossible, but not with God; all
things__are possible with God._ (Mk. 10:27) READ Mk. 10:17-27THOUGHT
FOR TODAY:What was the Teacher thinking? His own disciples werealarmed
and asked, "who then can be saved?" Jesusreplied, "_With man this is
impossible, but not with God; __all things are possible with God."
(vs. 27)_ It takes courageand faith._ "If you declare with your mouth,
Jesus is Lord, and__believe in your hear that God raised Him from the
dead,__your will be saved._ (Ro. 10:9) BELIEVE IN THE LORD JESUS,AND
YOU WILL BE SAVED. _ PASTOR AL_

subject: NOT A SIMPLE STORY
verse: The eyes of the Lord range throughout the earth to strengthen those whose hearts are fully committed to Him. (2 Chron. 16:9)
reflection: WHY, do our hearts need strengthening? Because doing the right thing may require courage and perseverance. Think of Job, hiscrime, he [was] blameless and upright. (Job 18) Joseph, [falsely] accused of attempted rape. was placed in prison for years. (Gen. 39: 19ff) Jerimiah, was beaten and put in prison. FOR WHAT? For telling the truth to rebellious people. (26: 15) Life is not simple, and God's ways are not our ways. Making the right decision may come at a cost. BUT IN GOD'S ETERNAL PLAN, HIS BLESSINGS ARRIVE IN DUE TIME. AND GOD HELPS THOSE WHO DEPEND ON HIM.
original_content:
VERSE FOR JUNE 1:_The eyes of the Lord range throughout the earth_ _to
strengthen __those whose hearts are fully_ _committed to Him._ ((2
Chron. 16:9) READ (2 Chron. 16:7-14)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:WHY, do our
hearts need strengthening? Because doing the right thing may require
courage and perseverance. Think of Job, hiscrime, he [was] blameless
and upright. (Job 18) Joseph, [falsely] accused of attempted rape.was
placed in prison for years. (Gen. 39:19ff) Jerimiah, was beaten and
put in prison. FOR WHAT? For telling the truth to rebellious people.
(26:15) Life is not simple, and God's ways are not our ways. Making
the right decision may come at a cost. BUT IN GOD'S ETERNAL PLAN, HIS
BLESSINGS ARRIVE IN DUE TIME. AND GOD HELPS THOSE WHO DEPEND ON HIM.
